metadata.title: CVE-2019-11705 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw in Thunderbird's implementation of iCal causes a stack bufferoverflow in icalrecur_add_bydayrules when processing certain emailmessages, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 60.7.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
